channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. women fencers parry and riposte to Olympic gold in Paris, besting Italy
item.description: Italy's women are the top-ranked fencers in the world with the foil. But in a tense Olympic final on Thursday, the U.S. women prevailed for the gold medal.
item.content:encoded:
Italy's women are the top-ranked fencers in the world with the foil. But in a tense Olympic final on Thursday, the U.S. women prevailed for the gold medal.

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: American swimmers struggle again at Paris Olympics, but Ledecky breaks another record
item.description: U.S. swimmers won only one gold on Thursday. But Katie Ledecky's silver medal in a relay race brought her career tally to thirteen Olympic medals, more than any other woman swimmer in history.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. swimmers won only one gold on Thursday. But Katie Ledecky's silver medal in a relay race brought her career tally to thirteen Olympic medals, more than any other woman swimmer in history.

(Image credit: Ashley Landis)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: The virtual roll call to make Harris the official Democratic nominee is underway
item.description: The virtual roll call began Thursday morning, and will conclude Monday evening, the deadline for Democratic delegates to return their ballots.
item.content:encoded:
The virtual roll call began Thursday morning, and will conclude Monday evening, the deadline for Democratic delegates to return their ballots.

(Image credit: Mark Felix)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: Why are Olympic swimmers bundled up like they're competing in the Winter Games?
item.description: As Team U.S.A. climbs the Olympics swimming charts, searches for "why do swimmers wear parkas?" are trending on Google.
item.content:encoded:
As Team U.S.A. climbs the Olympics swimming charts, searches for "why do swimmers wear parkas?" are trending on Google.

(Image credit: Oli Scarff)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Simone Biles takes gold in women’s gymnastics individual all-around at Paris Games
item.description: Thursday's women's gymnastics individual all-around competition showcases three of the sport's superstars: USA's Simone Biles and Suni Lee and Rebeca Andrade of Brazil.
item.content:encoded: Thursday's women's gymnastics individual all-around competition showcases three of the sport's superstars: USA's Simone Biles and Suni Lee and Rebeca Andrade of Brazil.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: The scramble to keep up with multiple wildfires on Colorado's Front Range
item.description: At least four wildfires on Colorado's populous Front Range have caused thousands of people to evacuate and one death. None of the fires are under control and conditions are ripe for more to start.
item.content:encoded: At least four wildfires on Colorado's populous Front Range have caused thousands of people to evacuate and one death. None of the fires are under control and conditions are ripe for more to start.

item.title: Venezuela's president vows to tighten grip on power after disputed election result
item.description: Venezuelan security forces have arrested more than 1,000 people since Sunday’s contested elections. Electoral authorities declared incumbent Maduro the winner but have refused to provide proof.
item.content:encoded: Venezuelan security forces have arrested more than 1,000 people since Sunday’s contested elections. Electoral authorities declared incumbent Maduro the winner but have refused to provide proof.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: GOP VP candidate J.D. Vance goes on the attack during visit to the southern border
item.description: On a three-day campaign sweep through Nevada and Arizona, Republican vice-presidential candidate J.D. Vance repeatedly pinned what he called the failures of the Biden administration on Kamala Harris.
item.content:encoded: On a three-day campaign sweep through Nevada and Arizona, Republican vice-presidential candidate J.D. Vance repeatedly pinned what he called the failures of the Biden administration on Kamala Harris.

item.title: Hezbollah and Hamas bury slain leaders as Iran eyes revenge
item.description: Hezbollah and Hamas have buried their slain leaders. The leader of Iran-backed Hezbollah, Hassan Nasrallah, said the war in Gaza had now entered a new phase.
item.content:encoded: Hezbollah and Hamas have buried their slain leaders. The leader of Iran-backed Hezbollah, Hassan Nasrallah, said the war in Gaza had now entered a new phase.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: A new kind of blood test can detect signs of Alzheimer’s with remarkable accuracy
item.description: New blood tests are set to change how Alzheimer's is diagnosed and treated by offering an easy way to see if patients have amyloid plaques and tau tangles in their brains — hallmarks of the disease.
item.content:encoded: New blood tests are set to change how Alzheimer's is diagnosed and treated by offering an easy way to see if patients have amyloid plaques and tau tangles in their brains — hallmarks of the disease.
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton
